comments:
This course is an introduction to the study of culture and human institutions, how they change, and their role in both literate and non-literate societies.

Students for the most part enjoyed this "interesting" and "stimulating" course. They found the readings for the class valuable. Overall, students reported that they learned a great deal.

Students enjoyed having Dr. Urban as a professor. One student noted, "Dr. Urban is an outstanding professor. He was incredibly engaging during each lecture and was actually laugh-out-loud funny throughout the semester." Another student said, "Professor Urban is very personable in lecture, which makes the denser subject matter easier to understand." Others students frequently used words such as "engaging" and "charismatic" to describe him.

Most of the course work consists of reading. Students highly recommended this course to both majors and non-majors. This course has no prerequisites and fulfills the Society sector requirement.
